Detailed Description

Configuration for a conflatee.

Examples:

examples/bot.c.

Field Documentation

char* conflate_config_t::host

The XMPP server address (may be NULL).

This is optional -- setting this to NULL will allow for normal XMPP SRV lookups to locate the server.

Examples:
examples/bot.c.
void(* conflate_config_t::log)(void *udata, enum conflate_log_level level, const char *msg,...) __gcc_attribute__((format(printf

Logging callback (optional).

If you do not specify a logger, one will be suplied for you that sends a lot of stuff to stderr.

Parameters:
udata The client's custom user data
level log level (see conflate_log_level)
msg the message to log
Examples:
examples/bot.c.
void(*) void(* conflate_config_t::new_config)(void *, kvpair_t *)

Callback issued when a new configuration is to be activated.

This callback will receive the caller's userdata and a kvpair_t of all of the keys and values received when things changed.

The new config *may* be the same as the previous config. It's up to the client to detect and decide what to do in this case.

Examples:
examples/bot.c.
char* conflate_config_t::software

Name of the software using libconflate.

For example: awesomeproxy

Examples:
examples/bot.c.
char* conflate_config_t::version

Version number of the software running libconflate.

For example: 1.3.3-8-gee0c3d5

Examples:
examples/bot.c.
